medical_history.chief_complaint: Pruritic, painful, white papules on the palms bilaterally.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first became aware of the condition approximately 7 months prior to evaluation during her field hockey season. Symptoms became more pronounced and painful with sweating or wetting of her hands. Previous treatment with clotrimazole cream produced little response. Over approximately 1 to 2 years, the problem gradually abated without treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No history of skin disease, abnormal scalp hair, or atopic diathesis.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for an uncle with an unidentified form of hand dermatitis and hay fever in her sister and father.
